column4: I am unable to mount my vfat partition at all... fdisk -l tells me it is W95 Ext'd (LBA) but mount says wrong superblock error. What now?
sudo mount /dev/<devicenode> -t vfat /<mountpoint>
I know that, but it gives a superblock error.
shouldn't be a super block.   check the device node exists and the mount point exists and is a dir.
/dev/sda5 /d vfat rw,user,noexec,noauto,dev,async 0 0 and /d is a directory.
there's your problem.
do tell?
you have fs specific switches that cant be used with vfat.   man mount.
/dev/sda5 /d vfat defaults  0 0 still generates the error
then it's not vfat.   fsck that bad boy.
if I use disks-admin, it temporairly mounts the disks, it reports the filesystem as vfat too and if I run sudo nautilus /tmp/disks-conf-sda5 I can see the contents...
any ideas? So I know the disk is OK
do you ?      run  sudo fsck /dev/sda5      and see what it says.

Yeah, I know the disk is ok, you ,usn't have got this: if I use disks-admin, it temporairly mounts the disks, it reports the filesystem as vfat too and if I run sudo nautilus /tmp/disks-conf-sda5 I can see the contents...
http://pastebin.com/754954
fsck reports it as vfat too/
no it isn't! I /can/ read the contents!
it also reports  "9" file allocation tables found.
that leaves me perplexed as to how I am able to access them when disks-admin mounts them.
can't answer that,  but i can telly you that mount seems to be failing vecause it's not finding an fat on the vfat system.
then what can I do about that?
disk admin maybe mounting as ext....     if you can cp the files out of there  format that dude.
an fs with errors is a major issue looking for data to eat....
